items.title: PypI release
items.body: Hi! I use pipenv and I have constant problems with locking dependencies, because the xenon requirements is yaml, <5.0, and everything below is in beta. An update to pypi would allow not to lock pre-release dependecies

items.title: Flake8 plugin
items.body:
Hi! Thanks for this awesome package.

I guess that user-base can be extended if you create a `flake8` plugin for `xenon`.
So, here's how the final usage will look like:

1. `pip install flake8 xenon`
2. `flake8 .` (runs both `flake8` and `xenon`)

items.title: Incompatible versions in the dependencies
items.body:
The current PyPI version of `xenon` couldn't be installed using `pipenv`. It seems different dependencies of `xenon` refer to incompatible versions of PyYaml (`pyyaml<5.0,>=4.2b1`).

Versions:
- Python 3.7.2
- Pipenv 2018.11.26

How to reproduce:
```
$ pipenv install --dev xenon
```

```
Installing xenon…
Adding xenon to Pipfile's [dev-packages]…
✔ Installation Succeeded
```

items.title: Version resolution miss-match
items.body:
While working on a project that uses secure version of `pyyaml` I have failed to install `xenon` with `poetry`, because these packages rely on different library versions:


```
Because no versions of layer-linter match >0.12.0,<0.13.0
 and layer-linter (0.12.0) depends on PyYAML (>=4.2b1,<5.0.0), layer-linter (>=0.1
2.0,<0.13.0) requires PyYAML (>=4.2b1,<5.0.0).
Thus, layer-linter (>=0.12.0,<0.13.0) is incompatible with xenon (>=0.5,<0.6).
So, because kira depends on both xenon (^0.5) and layer-linter (^0.12.0), version
solving failed.
```

Steps:

1. `poetry init` - to create a new project
2. `poetry add xenon`
3. `poetry add layer-lint`

items.title: Logger in xenon.core.analyze
items.body: what I am supposed to pass in argument for logger ?

items.title: LICENSE file not included in the pip source package
items.body: LICENSE file is not present in the pip tar.gz file. Would be nice to have it on the package to comply with MIT license.

items.title: Latest version of radon causes weird warnings with xenon 0.5.2
items.body:
Running `xenon` (version `0.5.1` or `0.5.2` with `mando-0.3.3` and `radon-1.4.2`) on our code base (Python 2.7) works as expected. But as of very recently, the latest dependencies (`mando-0.6.4`  and `radon-2.0.3`) are causing weird warnings of this form:

```
WARNING:xenon:cannot parse path/to/source.py: invalid syntax (<unknown>, line 1)
```

There is nothing wrong with those (dozens of) files. Downgrading to `radon-1.4.2` gets rid of the warnings.

Not a critical issue, but figured worth opening a ticket for :slightly_smiling_face: Thanks!

PS1. I just confirmed that `radon-2.0.2` works. The issue was introduced in `radon-2.0.3` :information_source: 
PS2. Oops, looks like there was already a ticket in `radon`'s issue tracker: https://github.com/rubik/radon/issues/133

items.title: Update PyYAML requirement to allow 3.12
items.body: PyYAML 3.11 fails compilation during `pip install`. If `xenon` allowed PyYaml 3.12, which [added Windows wheels](http://pyyaml.org/wiki/PyYAML#History) for Py27, 34, and 35, then Windows users would be super happy :-)

items.title: Update radon dependency
items.body:
Hello,

Could we update radon dependency to the latest version (1.4) ?

Pull request -> https://github.com/rubik/xenon/pull/14

Thanks :)

items.title: Not usable on Windows
items.body:
Since `xenon` depends on `sh`, it will not work on Windows (see [sh](https://github.com/NiranjanaD/sh)).

If not fixed, maybe this could be documented ?

items.title: --no-assert falsely requires an option.
items.body: Radon handles --no-assert with no arguments. Xenon requires an option to be passed to --no-assert when one is not needed.

items.title: Yaml dependency
items.body:
On installing xenon via `pip install xenon`, `yaml` dependency is missing.
Additionally, one cannot simply `pip install yaml`, so I'm not sure about wich implementation of `yaml` was used.

items.title: Implement config file capability
items.body: It is among the command line options, but it does not work yet.

items.title: Make README more useful and adequate
Add option to send JSON result somewhere
items.body: To some API server for example.

items.title: Doesn't like to be installed from pypi
items.body:
I can't seem to get xenon to install with a simple pip install. I tried with a python setup.py install as well and got the same result. It looks like the README.rst isn't included in the distribution on pypi.

```
[josh@jh-mbp tmp]$ virtualenv xenonradon

Installing Pip.....................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................................done.

[josh@jh-mbp xenonradon]$ source bin/activate
(xenonradon)[josh@jh-mbp xenonradon]$ php install radon
Could not open input file: install
(xenonradon)[josh@jh-mbp xenonradon]$ pip install radon
```
